Constructor Detail

Method Detail

reset

public void reset(int fill)

getMemory

public short getMemory(short absoluteAddress)
Retrieves the 16-bit word stored at the absolute memory address in the Machine. A memory address is given by a 16-bit quantity where the upper 7 bits denote the page number and the lower 9 bits denote the offset within that page.

Parameters:
absoluteAddress - 16-bit representation of the absolute memory address.
Returns:
the contents of the address.

getMemory

public short getMemory(byte page,
                       short pageOffset)
Retrieves the 16-bit word stored at the relative memory offset of the indicated page of the Machine's memory.

Parameters:
page - the jth page in all of memory
pageOffset - the ith word of the jth page.
Returns:
the contents of the ith word of the jth page.

setMemory

public void setMemory(short absoluteAddress,
                      short value)
Sets the contents of the 16-bit word stored at the absolute memory address of the current page to a 16-bit value in the Machine. A memory address is given by a 16-bit quantity where the upper 7 bits denote the page number and the lower 9 bits denote the offset within that page.

Parameters:
absoluteAddress - 16-bit representation of the absolute memory address.
value - a 16-bit value to be stored in memory.

setMemory

public void setMemory(byte page,
                      short pageOffset,
                      short value)
Sets the contents of the 16-bit word stored at the relative memory offset of the current page to a 16-bit value of the Machine's memory.

Parameters:
page - the jth page in all of memory
pageOffset - the ith word of the jth page.
value - a 16-bit value to be stored in memory.

hasHalted

public boolean hasHalted()
A TRAP HALT will cause the Machine to stop running.

Returns:
whether the Machine no longer intends to continue processing instructions.

halt

public void halt()
Called by TRAP HALT to cause the Machine to stop running.

clockCount

public int clockCount()
The number of instructions that have been executed since the Machine began. The clock count is incremented with each clock cycle.

stepClock

public void stepClock()
Executes the next clock cycle.

getRegister

public Register getRegister(int index)

getPCRegister

public Register getPCRegister()

getFlags

public FlagsRegister getFlags()

nextInstruction

public short nextInstruction()
Retrieves the value from the PC Register, then increments it as an atomic operation.

Returns:
the relative memory offset from the current page of the next instruction to be executed.
